data.title: 准备以至少30秒的时间回答以下问题
data.answer: In a typical alley in India, two men are moving a large bucket of paprika, which attracts the interest of a woman in red. India is renowned for its chilis. The chili in the picture may be the famous Bhut Jolokia. It is also known as ‘ghost pepper’ and is cultivated in the North-Eastern states of the country in Assam, Manipur, Nagaland, and Arunachal Pradesh. It was certified as the hottest chili in the world by the Guinness Book in 2007. The Bhut Jolokia is consumed both as a spice and food in the form of pickles and goes well with the combination of dried or fermented fish and pork dishes.
